articles.headline: Bailout Is Over for Portugal, but Side Effects Will Linger
articles.snippet: The country’s economy is growing again, but slowly, and unemployment is still above 15 percent.
articles.abstract: The country’s economy is growing again, but slowly, and unemployment is still above 15 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: LISBON — Europe’s climb out of its debt crisis has been narrated by a long debate on whether the austerity imposed on countries that needed international bailouts would bring more pain than relief.

articles.headline: Berkshire’s Radical Strategy: Trust
articles.snippet: The top executives of Berkshire Hathaway believe in trusting their employees.
articles.abstract: The top executives of Berkshire Hathaway believe in trusting their employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: OMAHA –“By the standards of the rest of the world, we overtrust. So far it has worked very well for us. Some would see it as weakness.”

articles.headline: Chasing Death Camp Guards With New Tools
articles.snippet: Modern advances being applied to historical crimes include virtual models of Nazi camps to demonstrate what guards would have been able to see from their posts.
articles.abstract: Modern advances being applied to historical crimes include virtual models of Nazi camps to demonstrate what guards would have been able to see from their posts.
articles.lead_paragraph: STUTTGART, Germany — After years of relative inaction, German prosecutors have opened dozens of fresh investigations of men and women suspected of having served as Nazi death camp guards, racing against the clock to bring the aging suspects to justice. Not since the end of World War II have so many cases been initiated at once.

articles.headline: A Coffee Crop Withers
articles.snippet: A plant-choking fungus called coffee rust has hurt farmers and sent economic damages rippling through local communities.
articles.abstract: A plant-choking fungus called coffee rust has hurt farmers and sent economic damages rippling through local communities.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN LUCAS TOLIMÁN, Guatemala — When coffee rust attacked the farms clinging to the volcanic slopes above this Mayan town, the disease was unsparing, reducing mountainside rows of coffee trees to lattices of gray twigs.

articles.headline: High-Tech Push Has Board Games Rolling Again
articles.snippet: With eye-popping graphics, visceral action and an online community, video games should have killed tabletop games, but in fact the opposite is true.
articles.abstract: With eye-popping graphics, visceral action and an online community, video games should have killed tabletop games, but in fact the opposite is true.
articles.lead_paragraph: MERCER ISLAND, Wash. — Dan Shapiro sold a company to Google and worked at Microsoft. His name is on nearly a dozen technology-related patents.

articles.headline: Obama Aides Tell Executives to Skip Forum
articles.snippet: The White House has pressured the executives of some of America’s largest corporations into canceling plans to attend an economic forum in Russia to be hosted by President Vladimir V. Putin this month.
articles.abstract: The White House has pressured the executives of some of America’s largest corporations into canceling plans to attend an economic forum in Russia to be hosted by President Vladimir V. Putin this month.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House has pressured the chief executives of some of America’s largest energy, financial and industrial corporations into canceling plans to attend an international economic forum in Russia to be hosted by President Vladimir V. Putin this month, the latest effort to isolate Moscow in retaliation for its intervention in Ukraine.

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Moguls’ Pay Has the 1% Looking Up
articles.snippet: The 25 highest-earning hedge fund managers in the United States took home a total of $21.15 billion in compensation in 2013, according to an annual ranking.
articles.abstract: The 25 highest-earning hedge fund managers in the United States took home a total of $21.15 billion in compensation in 2013, according to an annual ranking.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hedge fund managers heavily populate the so-called 1 percent in the United States. And they are getting richer.

articles.headline: Bayer Deal to Expand Consumer Business With Merck Deal
articles.snippet: The German drug maker agreed to acquire Merck’s consumer care business for $14.2 billion, gaining control of Claritin, Coppertone and Dr. Scholl’s.
articles.abstract: The German drug maker agreed to acquire Merck’s consumer care business for $14.2 billion, gaining control of Claritin, Coppertone and Dr. Scholl’s.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 12:06 p.m. | LONDON — The German drug maker Bayer said on Tuesday that it had agreed to acquire Merck’s consumer care business for $14.2 billion, a deal that will make Bayer one of the largest providers of over-the-counter products.
articles.byline: By Chad Bray and Katie Thomas

articles.headline: Sotomayor Finds Her Voice Among Justices
articles.snippet: Justice Sonia Sotomayor has emerged as an increasingly confident figure on the Supreme Court, staking out positions that have led to testy exchanges with colleagues across the ideological spectrum.
articles.abstract: Justice Sonia Sotomayor has emerged as an increasingly confident figure on the Supreme Court, staking out positions that have led to testy exchanges with colleagues across the ideological spectrum.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — “I am a lawyer’s judge,” Justice Sonia Sotomayor said last year. “I write very technically.”
